alert.note: Alert for Monroe Lower Keys (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 7:49PM EDT by NWS Key West
info.description: ...A LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT LOWER KEYS THROUGH 845 PM EDT... At 748 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 17 miles north of Marquesas Keys to 18 miles south of Key West. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Key West, Boca Chica, Big Coppitt Key, Boca Chica Channel Bridge, Niles Channel Bridge, Saddlebunch Keys, Geiger Key, Sunset Key, Shark Key, and Upper Sugarloaf Key. This includes US 1 between mile markers 0 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
